provenance.name: British Museum
provenance.note: The entire series of water colors was commissioned by the publisher Richard Edwards c. 1795; passed to his brother Thomas Edwards of Halifax c. 1799 when Richard Edwards left Britain; offered by Thomas Edwards in his catalogue of *Superb Books of Prints, Atlases, Books Printed on Vellum with Miniatures, and Other Superlatively Fine Articles* of 1821, item 3, two volumes bound in red morocco (£300); offered at a Winstanley's auction, Manchester, 10 May 1826, lot 1076 (not sold on a reserve of £50); offered at a Stewart, Wheatley, and Adlard auction, London, 15-24 May 1828, ninth day, lot 1130 (bought-in at £52.10s.); by inheritance to the widow of Rev. John Edwards; sold 1874 through the dealer H. W. Birtwhistle of Halifax and the London dealer James Rimell for £475 to the dealer James Bain; sold by 1905 through Scribner, the New York dealer, to Marsden J. Perry of Providence, Rhode Island, for £1500; sold 1908 to William Augustus White of Brooklyn, New York; by inheritance in 1926 to White's daughter, Frances White Emerson; given by Emerson to the British Museum in the winter of 1928-29. A label accompanying the designs, probably written by W. A. White, states that he acquired them with other works by Blake from Marsden J. Perry on 28 March 1908.

desc.objtitle: Verso Sketch on Object 1 of Young's Night Thoughts, object 1 (Butlin 330.1 verso)

objnote.p: This pencil sketch on the verso of the first leaf of Blake's *Night Thoughts* illustrations is a preliminary drawing for the water color on the recto; see object 1. The mount, top right, is signed in pen and ink by the publisher who commissioned Blake's designs, "Richard Edwards / High Elms." He probably signed the mount no later than c. 1799 when he left Britain and the water colors passed into the possession of his brother Thomas Edwards. Below the signature is a pencil inscription by William Augustus White, "W a White / 28 March 19[08, trimmed off] / of M. J. Perry." White acquired the entire series of designs from Marsden J. Perry in 1908; see the Note on Provenance on the Work Information page.

illustration.illusobjdesc: A lightly sketched nude male stands in the center of the design. This is Christ, as in the water color on the recto for which this sketch is a preliminary drawing. Lines around his head suggest beams of light or radiance. The figure faces right with his torso twisted forward and his head turned to the left. Both arms are raised at 135 degrees and his hands are not clearly pictured. The figure's left leg is bent with the left foot raised on tiptoe; he may walk to the right. Alternatively, the figure may be flying or hovering. Lightly sketched lines in the upper left corner and along the right border suggest clouds or perhaps smoke. A lightly sketched angel with folded wings kneels in the lower right portion of the design. The figure faces left with his head turned down. His left arm is bent slightly and may rest on his lap. A lightly sketched circle visible in the lower left portion of the design may represent the head of an indistinct figure. This is probably a rough indication of the angel pictured lower left in the water color on the recto. Two lightly sketched male faces appear near the left center border of the design. One with curly hair faces forward; the other, pictured immediately to the left, faces left in profile. These faces were not retained in the water color on the recto and may be unrelated to this preliminary drawing.

desc.objtitle: Verso Sketch on Object 1 of Young's Night Thoughts, top mount inscription

objnote.p: The first two lines of the inscription were written by Richard Edwards, who commissioned Blake's *Night Thoughts* illustrations. William Augustus White, who acquired the water color series from Marsden J. Perry in 1908, wrote lines 3-5 in pencil.
